challenges.title: Null Safety in Kotlin
challenges.description: What is the purpose of the 'let' function in Kotlin?
challenges.explanation: The 'let' function is a scope function that executes a block of code only if the object is not null. It's commonly used for null-safe operations.

challenges.title: Extension Functions
challenges.description: How do you declare an extension function in Kotlin?
challenges.explanation: Extension functions are declared by prefixing the function name with the receiver type. The syntax is 'fun ReceiverType.functionName()'.

challenges.title: Data Classes
challenges.description: What is automatically generated for a Kotlin data class?
options: toString(), equals(), hashCode(), copy(), componentN() functions
challenges.correct_answer: toString(), equals(), hashCode(), copy(), componentN() functions
challenges.explanation: Data classes automatically generate toString(), equals(), hashCode(), copy(), and componentN() functions for destructuring declarations.
